column4: hey does anyone know a decent music player that can browse itunes shares?
banshee
curses! none for kde?
hehe, oh man you run kde?
hahaha
j/k
uh, yeah, i do... it's actually way more popular than gnome
I was just joking around
are there numbers or some kind of metric that keeps track of that?
um. there's polls and stuff... nothing rigorous
ahh, hrm....there should be though don't you think?
well rhythmbox was pretty coo last time i tried it... which was like... four years ago
sure... how would you do it, exactly?
probably make some kind of web service that talks to clients
90% of linux users wouldn't do it on account of privacy concerns
so that when KDE / GNOME is installed  it'll +1
there's a metric for that too?
you could get statistics from, e.g. debian servers
hrmm..
that's probably doable.... actually they post package popularity counts
well check out banshee it's far from polished but it works with browsing iTunes shares
will do
sweet
